census_year.title: Census year
census_year.description: The CLUE census year refers to the year in which surveying was completed.

block_id.title: Block ID
block_id.description: The Census area is divided into city blocks, each of which is identified by a unique block number. Blocks are primarily defined by major roads. There are around 606 blocks in the City of Melbourne.

clue_small_area.title: CLUE small area
clue_small_area.description: CLUE small areas are composed of a group of city blocks, each of which is identified by a unique block number.

commercial_accommodation.title: Commercial Accommodation
commercial_accommodation.description: Short to medium term commercial accommodation, including hotels. Hostels/backpacker hotels, private hotels/boarding houses and serviced accommodation

common_area.title: Common Area
common_area.description: Indoor open space, such as circulation areas, toilets, foyers, stairwells, lift shafts, rooftops etc

community_use.title: Community Use
community_use.description: Public libraries, jails and public toilets

educational_research.title: Educational/Research
educational_research.description: Space used for the conduct of training, educational, or research activities (e.g. Schools, colleges, research laboratories). Space will be used as classrooms, training rooms or laboratories for training purposes.

entertainment_recreation_indoor.title: Entertainment/Recreation - Indoor
entertainment_recreation_indoor.description: Space used for a range of indoor entertainment and recreational pursuits (e.g. restaurants, cinemas, theatres, clubs, taverns, brothels, bowling alleys, gymnasiums)

equipment_installation.title: Equipment Installation
equipment_installation.description: Space exclusively used to house bulky plant and equipment such as printing plant, mainframe computers, air conditioning systems, electricity substations etc.

hospital_clinic.title: Hospital/Clinic
hospital_clinic.description: Space used for the conduct of medical or surgical treatment. Characterised by consulting rooms and medical wards. Laboratories used in conduct of commercial activities (e.g. Pathology laboratories) are included here. Commonly located in office type space

house_townhouse.title: House/Townhouse
house_townhouse.description: Detached, semi-detached, townhouse or terrace style residential accommodation

institutional_accommodation.title: Institutional Accommodation
institutional_accommodation.description: Accommodation providing various lengths of stay but usually provided as community services e.g. Shelters, supported accommodation, correctional facilities etc.

manufacturing.title: Manufacturing
manufacturing.description: Manufacturing involves the physical or chemical transformation of materials or components into new products. This includes the manufacture of food, machinery, clothing, and scientific equipment, as well as printing.

office.title: Office
office.description: Conduct of clerical/white collar work. Professional services such as law, accounting etc. are usually coded here

park_reserve.title: Park/Reserve
park_reserve.description: Public open space set aside as parks or reserves

parking_commercial_covered.title: Parking - Commercial Covered
parking_commercial_covered.description: Covered parking devoted to hire or lease to the public

parking_commercial_uncovered.title: Parking - Commercial Uncovered
parking_commercial_uncovered.description: Open-air parking devoted to hire or lease to the public

parking_private_covered.title: Parking - Private Covered
parking_private_covered.description: Covered parking devoted to residential or commercial establishments, not for hire or lease to the public

parking_private_uncovered.title: Parking - Private Uncovered
parking_private_uncovered.description: Open-air parking devoted to residential or commercial establishments, not for hire or lease to the public

performances_conferences_ceremonies.title: Performances, Conferences, Ceremonies
performances_conferences_ceremonies.description: Space used for public presentations, generally with seating and a performance area such as a stage. Includes theatres, churches, cinemas, concert halls, courts, parliamentary chambers and conference facilities

private_outdoor_space.title: Private Outdoor Space
private_outdoor_space.description: Private outdoor open space, such as courtyards etc. Also includes unbuilt space around buildings.

public_display_area.title: Public Display Area
public_display_area.description: Space used for (non-retail) displays, including museums, nonretail galleries, and exhibition space. Note that retail galleries and showrooms are included under space use B3

retail_cars.title: Retail - Cars
retail_cars.description: Space used for the display of cars for sale

retail_shop.title: Retail - Shop
retail_shop.description: The general retail sale of a wide range of goods or services in an enclosed structure.

retail_showroom.title: Retail - Showroom
retail_showroom.description: Space used for the display of goods for sale, excluding cars. Does not include exhibition space (Y)

retail_stall.title: Retail - Stall
retail_stall.description: The general retail sale of a wide range of goods or services from a structure that may be relocatable or not self-enclosed (e.g. flower stall, new kiosk, key cutter). These must be a separate establishment and not part of a larger business

square_promenade.title: Square/Promenade
square_promenade.description: Public open space with paved or other hard surface

storage.title: Storage
storage.description: Space used to store goods, either as a business (e.g. Furniture storage, grain storage) or in the course of conducting other business (e.g. File storage)

student_accommodation.title: Student Accommodation
student_accommodation.description: Medium to long term accommodation for students; may have shared facilities or be self-contained (does not include student apartments, which are coded as L2 residential apartment)

transport.title: Transport
transport.description: Space used to conduct freight or passenger transport (e.g. railway stations, bus/tram/coach depots)

transport_storage_uncovered.title: Transport/Storage - Uncovered
transport_storage_uncovered.description: Space use to apply to a property that is a majority of unbuilt land used for storage (for example transport containers). These land parcels may contain some built/covered storage structures but are predominantly unbuilt.

unoccupied_under_construction.title: Unoccupied - Under Construction
unoccupied_under_construction.description: Space being constructed at time of survey

unoccupied_under_demolition_condemned.title: Unoccupied - Under Demolition/Condemned
unoccupied_under_demolition_condemned.description: Space under demolition/condemned at time of survey

unoccupied_under_renovation.title: Unoccupied - Under Renovation
unoccupied_under_renovation.description: Space being renovated at time of survey

unoccupied_unused.title: Unoccupied - Unused
unoccupied_unused.description: Vacant or leased but not used

wholesale.title: Wholesale
wholesale.description: Wholesaling involves the purchase and resale of goods/services to another organisation. Wholesalers are involved in minimal sales directly to the public.

workshop_studio.title: Workshop/Studio
workshop_studio.description: This space use will most likely be encountered in design studios (e.g. architectural, graphics, advertising) or in workshops undertaking such activities as repairs (e.g. watchmaking, appliances, cars etc,)

total_space_in_block.title: Total space in block
total_space_in_block.description: Total amount of space in block
